Simulate data as in Ewald et al. (2024)

Source: R/data-sim.R
sim_dgp_ewald.Rd

– X1, X3 and X5 are independent and standard normal: Xj ∼ N (0, 1), – X2 is a noisy copy of X1: X2 := X1 + eps_2, eps_2 ∼ N (0, 0.001), – X4 is a (more) noisy copy of X3: X4 := X3 + eps_4, eps_4 ∼ N (0, 0.1), – Y depends on X4 and X5 via linear effects and a bivariate interaction: Y := X4 + X5 + X4 ∗ X5 + eps_Y , eps_Y ∼ N (0, 0.1).

Usage

sim_dgp_ewald(n = 500)

Arguments

n

(integer(1)) Number of samples to create.

Value

A regression task (mlr3::TaskRegr) with data.table backend.

Examples

sim_dgp_ewald(100)
#> <TaskRegr:Ewald_100> (100 x 6)
#> * Target: y
#> * Properties: -
#> * Features (5):
#>   - dbl (5): x1, x2, x3, x4, x5
